intro: Adesmia leucopogon, commonly known as the white-horned burr, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a legume, typically containing several seeds, and it thrives in dry, arid environments. Adesmia leucopogon is often found in scrublands and rocky soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing the ecosystem.
